alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Dawson; Furnas; Gosper; Harlan; Phelps (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 24 at 10:56PM CDT until June 24 at 11:45PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: The National Weather Service in Hastings has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Phelps County in south central Nebraska... Southwestern Buffalo County in south central Nebraska... Gosper County in south central Nebraska... Southern Dawson County in south central Nebraska... Furnas County in south central Nebraska... Harlan County in south central Nebraska... * Until 1145 PM CDT. * At 1055 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Johnson Lake to near Arapahoe to 10 miles south of Hendley, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Edison around 1100 PM CDT. Lexington around 1105 PM CDT. Oxford around 1110 PM CDT. Overton, Loomis and Atlanta around 1120 PM CDT. Holdrege around 1130 PM CDT. Elm Creek and Ragan around 1135 PM CDT. Alma, Odessa and Funk around 1140 PM CDT. Republican City around 1145 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Farnam. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 231 and 265. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Buffalo; Dawson; Furnas; Gosper; Harlan; Phelps
